tasks.title: Define project vision and problem statement
tasks.description: Establish the core purpose: A comprehensive calculator suite to replace multiple calculator apps with one elegant workspace.

subtasks.title: Identify pain point: Too many separate calculator apps
Define tagline: Calculate everything. Plan anything.

tasks.title: Research calculator categories and Indian finance context
tasks.description: Research which calculators are most needed for Indian users - SIP, FD, RD, PPF, tax regimes, etc.

subtasks.title: List investment calculators (SIP, Lumpsum, FD, RD, PPF)
List tax calculators (Old/New regime, HRA, Gratuity)
List utility calculators (Currency, Trip, Real Estate)

tasks.title: Create Product Requirements Document (PRD)
tasks.description: Document all features, calculator types, and acceptance criteria for AnyCalc.

tasks.title: Design system architecture and tech stack
tasks.description: Choose Next.js 14, TypeScript, Tailwind, Supabase, Recharts, Zustand. Design component structure.

tasks.title: Build core calculator UI components
tasks.description: Create reusable calculator input/output components with Radix UI primitives.

tasks.title: Implement Investment calculators (SIP, Lumpsum, FD, RD, PPF, CAGR)
tasks.description: Build 6 investment calculators with Indian-specific formatting and charts.

comments.author: arun
comments.content: For the SIP calculator make sure the step up option is clearly visible. Most people don't know they can increase SIP by ten percent every year. Put it as a toggle right below the monthly amount input. Also the goal planner reverse mode should be the second tab not hidden in a dropdown.

comments.author: arun
comments.content: FD calculator looks correct. Verified against SBI FD calculator — numbers match for quarterly compounding at 7.1% for 5 years.

tasks.title: Implement Tax calculators (Tax Planner, HRA, Gratuity, GST, Salary)
tasks.description: Build 5 tax and salary calculators with Old vs New regime comparison.

subtasks.title: Tax Planner with Old vs New regime

comments.author: arun
comments.content: The tax planner needs to clearly show which regime saves more money. Right now it shows both calculations but the user has to mentally compare. Add a green highlighted box at the top that says you save X amount with the new regime or old regime — whichever is better. Make it obvious.

tasks.title: Implement EMI, Compound Interest, and Goal Planner calculators
tasks.description: Build loan and planning calculators with amortization schedules.

tasks.title: Implement Real Estate Capital Gains calculator
tasks.description: Complex calculator with Section 54, 54EC, 54F support and CII indexation (2001-2026).

comments.author: arun
comments.content: Important — the budget 2024 changed long term capital gains for real estate. Before it was twenty percent with indexation, now there's a new option of twelve point five percent without indexation. We need to support both and let the user compare which one is better for their specific case. The old regime is still available for properties bought before July 2024.

comments.author: arun
comments.content: CII values verified against Income Tax Department website. Section 54 logic correctly caps at one residential property. Section 54EC correctly caps at 50 lakhs. Good to go.

comments.author: arun
comments.content: Quick question — should we show the reinvestment amount needed for full exemption as a separate callout? Like if someone's capital gain is thirty lakhs, show them clearly that they need to invest thirty lakhs in a new property within two years for full Section 54 exemption. Make it actionable.

tasks.title: Implement utility calculators (BMI, Currency, Trip, World Clock, Cost of Living)
tasks.description: Build lifestyle and utility calculators.

tasks.title: Build Workspace mode for multi-calculator comparison
tasks.description: Create workspace view to open multiple calculators side-by-side.

tasks.title: Implement dark mode toggle
tasks.description: Add theme toggle for light/dark mode with system preference detection.

tasks.title: Add PDF/HTML export with notes section
tasks.description: Enable exporting calculator results to PDF and HTML formats with user notes.

tasks.title: Set up Vitest and Playwright for testing
tasks.description: Configure unit testing with Vitest and E2E testing with Playwright.

subtasks.title: Write unit tests for calculation logic

tasks.title: Test all calculators for accuracy
tasks.description: Verify all 19 calculators produce correct results against known values.

subtasks.title: Test SIP against mutual fund calculators
Test Tax with known tax scenarios
Test Real Estate with manual calculations

tasks.title: Set up Vercel deployment
tasks.description: Configure Vercel project with environment variables for Supabase.

tasks.title: Integrate Supabase for cloud sync
tasks.description: Add Supabase authentication and cloud sync for saving calculations.

subtasks.title: Add graceful fallback for missing env vars

tasks.title: Fix staging bugs and stability issues
tasks.description: Address localStorage crashes, EMI input freezes, and Section 54 calculation bugs.

subtasks.title: Fix page freeze on EMI input
Add safe JSON parsing for localStorage
Add defensive error handling to cloud sync

tasks.title: Rebrand to AnyCalc and update README
tasks.description: Rebrand from Calculate Anything to AnyCalc. Update README with badges and LAUNCHPAD block.

tasks.title: Configure custom domain anycalc.in
tasks.description: Set up custom domain on Vercel and verify DNS.

tasks.title: Production deployment and go-live
tasks.description: Final deployment to production at anycalc.in.

tasks.title: Post-launch bug fixes
tasks.description: Fix mobile layout issues and input field problems reported after launch.

subtasks.title: Fix mobile layout for EMI calculator

tasks.title: Create LinkedIn announcement post
tasks.description: Draft and publish LinkedIn post announcing AnyCalc launch.

tasks.title: Update portfolio with AnyCalc
tasks.description: Add AnyCalc to digital portfolio/resume.

tasks.title: Plan Phase 2 enhancements
tasks.description: Document future features: PWA support, share via link, CGAS tracking, NRI features.

subtasks.title: Document CGAS tracking for real estate

tasks.title: Initialize Tauri 2.0 project
tasks.description:
Create new Tauri project with React + TypeScript template.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Tauri 2.0 installed
- React 18 frontend
- TypeScript configured
- Project builds and runs

comments.author: arun
comments.content: Make sure to use Tauri 2.0 stable, not beta. Check the official docs for the latest template.

tasks.title: Configure Tailwind CSS
tasks.description:
Set up Tailwind CSS with dark theme configuration.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Tailwind installed and configured
- Dark theme colors defined
- Base styles applied

tasks.title: Set up Zustand store
tasks.description:
Create Zustand store for application state management.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Zustand installed
- Store structure defined
- Projects and tasks slices created
- TypeScript types for state

tasks.title: Create TypeScript type definitions
tasks.description:
Define TypeScript interfaces for all data structures.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Project interface
- Task interface
- Config interface
- Stage/Status enums
- All types exported

tasks.title: Implement file service (read/write JSON)
tasks.description:
Create service for reading and writing JSON files using Tauri FS API.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Read projects.json
- Read tasks.json
- Read config.json
- Write with validation
- 500ms debounce on write
- Error handling

tasks.title: Build app shell component
tasks.description:
Create main app layout with header and content area.

Acceptance Criteria:
- App header with title
- Main content area
- Dark theme styling
- Responsive layout

tasks.title: Build Pipeline Kanban view
tasks.description:
Create main dashboard with 5 stage columns for project cards.

Acceptance Criteria:
- 5 columns: Design, Engineering, Build, Launch, Closure
- Column headers with project count
- Scrollable columns
- Empty state for empty columns

comments.author: arun
comments.content: For the pipeline view each stage column should have a distinct color. Design is pink, Engineering is sky blue, Build is yellow, Launch is green, and Closure is teal. These colors should be consistent everywhere — project cards, progress bars, stage badges. Check the mockup HTML file for the exact hex values.

tasks.title: Build Project Card component
tasks.description:
Create project card for kanban view.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Shows: name, phase, progress bar, priority badge, task count
- Days since last update indicator
- Clickable to open modal
- Hover state

tasks.title: Build Quick Launch command palette
tasks.description:
Create command palette modal with fuzzy search.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Opens with Cmd+K / Ctrl+K
- Closes with Esc
- Fuzzy search projects and commands
- Keyboard navigation (arrows + enter)
- Recent items at top

comments.author: arun
comments.content: The command palette should feel like Spotlight on Mac or VS Code's command palette. When I hit Control K it should open instantly, no animation delay. Show recent projects first before any search. Also add keyboard shortcut hints next to each command — like Control one for projects tab, Control two for tasks tab. Makes it feel professional.

comments.author: arun
comments.content: Quick Launch is working well. The fuzzy search is snappy. One idea for later — add a section for recently opened documents in the results, not just projects.

tasks.title: Build Project Detail modal
tasks.description:
Create modal showing full project information.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Shows all project fields
- Stage history timeline
- Task summary
- Open in VS Code button
- Move to next stage button
- Closes with Esc or outside click

tasks.title: Implement global keyboard shortcuts
tasks.description:
Set up global keyboard shortcuts for the app.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Cmd+K opens Quick Launch
- Esc closes modals
- Arrow keys navigate lists
- Enter selects items

tasks.title: Implement file watcher (Rust backend)
tasks.description:
Create Rust backend to watch for file changes.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Watches projects.json, tasks.json, inbox.md
- Emits events to frontend on change
- 500ms debounce on rapid changes

tasks.title: Connect file watcher to UI auto-reload
tasks.description:
Wire up file watcher events to reload data and re-render UI.

Acceptance Criteria:
- UI updates when files change externally
- Shows toast notification
- No UI flicker

tasks.title: Add toast notification system
tasks.description:
Create toast notification component for user feedback.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Success, error, info variants
- Auto-dismiss after 3s
- Stackable notifications
- Dark theme styled

tasks.title: Implement 'Open in VS Code' command
tasks.description:
Add command to open project folder in VS Code.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Works from Quick Launch
- Works from Project Modal
- Uses shell command to open VS Code

tasks.title: Add loading and error states
tasks.description:
Implement loading states and error handling throughout the app.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Loading spinner on data fetch
- Error messages for failed operations
- Graceful degradation

tasks.title: Performance optimization
tasks.description:
Optimize app for performance targets.

Acceptance Criteria:
- App launch < 2s
- File load < 100ms
- UI response < 16ms (60fps)

tasks.title: Define vision: automatic strength level measurement

tasks.title: Research strength standards and progression models
tasks.description: Research existing strength standards (Symmetric Strength, ExRx) and rep-based progression models for automatic level calculation.

subtasks.title: Map strength levels: Beginner → Intermediate → Advanced → Elite
Define exercises per muscle group with level thresholds

tasks.title: Write APP_PRD.md with feature specifications
tasks.description: Create comprehensive PRD covering workout logging, strength profiling, progression tracking, and mobile-first UX requirements.

comments.author: arun
comments.content: PRD approved. Focus on compound lifts first, accessories can come later.
